_header: All tho that been enemies to the king
Subjects: Henry VI; pageant verses; chronicles, verse in
_description: Pageant verses for the return of Henry VI to London, A.D. 1432 — one stanza rhyme royal

HarEng766.Transcription:
Alle thoo that been Enymyes to the kyngI shall them clothe with
                    ConfuciounMake hym myghty by vertuous livinghis Mortall foon to
                    oppresse and bere hym downeAnd hym to encreace As Cristes
                    ChampyounAlle Mischevis ffrom hym to AbridgeWith grace of God At the
                    Entry of this Bridge
